enhancedContent.overview: Effective 1:1s transforms one-on-one meetings from unproductive status updates into meaningful coaching conversations. This Notion template provides structured frameworks for both managers and employees to prepare, conduct, and follow up on 1:1 meetings with clear agendas, discussion topics, and action items. With research showing that 78% of managers still use non-collaborative note-taking methods, this template creates a shared space for collaborative meeting preparation and documentation that benefits both parties and drives real development outcomes.

features: 4 different 1:1 framework categories for various meeting types
Pre-built agendas for career development, feedback, and check-ins
Action item tracking with owners and deadlines
Shared space for both manager and employee to add topics
Meeting notes accessible to both parties
Templates by meeting type and purpose

problemsSolved: Unproductive 1:1s that devolve into status updates available elsewhere instead of meaningful coaching and development
Poor meeting preparation leading to wasted time discussing surface-level topics instead of important issues
Lack of documentation and follow-through on action items discussed in 1:1s causing repeated conversations
Non-collaborative note-taking where managers keep private notes preventing shared accountability
solutionsBenefits: Transforms meetings into productive coaching sessions with structured frameworks that guide meaningful discussions
Enables collaborative preparation where both parties add topics beforehand, ensuring important issues are addressed
Creates accountability through shared documentation and action item tracking that both manager and employee can reference
Centralizes 1:1 history in Notion providing context from past meetings and tracking long-term development progress
idealFor: Managers conducting weekly or bi-weekly 1:1s who want to make meetings more effective and developmental
Employees (managees) who want to take ownership of their 1:1s and drive career development discussions
Remote teams needing structured async preparation and shared documentation for virtual 1:1s
New managers setting up 1:1 processes for the first time and needing proven frameworks
Teams transitioning from scattered notes to systematic 1:1 documentation in Notion
notRecommendedFor: Organizations with strict requirements for 1:1 documentation to remain in other systems like HR platforms
People who only have occasional 1:1s and don't need systematic templates

faqs.question: How do I get started with this template?
faqs.answer: After duplicating the template, select one of the 4 framework categories that matches your meeting type (career development, feedback, general check-in, or problem-solving). Duplicate that template, share it with your 1:1 partner, and both complete the preparation sections before your meeting. During the meeting, take collaborative notes and assign action items.

faqs.question: What's included in this template?
faqs.answer: The template includes 4 different 1:1 meeting frameworks for various purposes, collaborative agenda-setting sections, discussion topic prompts, action item tracking databases, meeting notes templates, historical meeting archive, and guidance on how to prepare and lead effective 1:1s for both managers and employees.

faqs.question: Can I customize this template?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can customize the meeting frameworks to match your organization's culture, add custom sections for specific discussion topics, modify the action item tracking properties, create additional templates for specific meeting types, and integrate with your existing Notion workspace for goals and project tracking.

faqs.question: What are the main use cases?
faqs.answer: Primary use cases include weekly manager-employee check-ins, career development and growth conversations, performance feedback and coaching sessions, problem-solving and blocker removal discussions, skip-level meetings for senior leadership, and creating documented accountability for action items and commitments made during 1:1s.
